name: Idownvotedyoubecause
tagline: Let other users know, in a helpful way, why you had to downvote their awful content to oblivion.
body:
### I downvoted you because...
This website is designed to help people understand why you downvoted them.

Participation in a reputation-ranked online community comes with its ups and downs.  You post something and get upvoted when people like or agree with it.  Unfortunately, you may also be downvoted because someone didn't agree or didn't like it.  

The goal for IDownvotedYouBecause is to allow users an **easy, productive and helpful** way to let someone know *what the problem was* that caused your downvote, *what they can do to fix it*, and *why you think they should do so*.  

### You can help make this website better!
This website is hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/WillSullivan/IDownvotedYouBecause) and served via [GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com/). This means that, if you have a GitHub account, you can request changes, updates, and new pages that cover different situations.  You can even add them yourself by [forking](https://help.github.com/articles/fork-a-repo/) the website's [repository](), making the changes as you see fit.  Once completed, you can send me, Will Sullivan (@willSullivan), a [pull request](https://help.github.com/articles/using-pull-requests/) to add your changes to the website.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
